featured.text: In a panic (B) With delight (C) Out of sorrow (D) Filled with embarrassment 39. (A) they had seen my car (B) there was a shop nearby (C) they had seen two small girls (D) there was a police station in the neighborhood 40.
Ground stations have been built to monitor larger pieces of space trash to prevent them from crashing into working satellites or space shuttles.
In the news recently was the story of a woman who died of a heart attack while driving her station wagon.
The passengers ______ escaped death when a bomb exploded in the subway station, killing sixty people.
PBS has 349 member television stations in the U.S. and some member stations by cable in Canada.

other.text: Which of the following is true about public television stations? (A)
Newspapers, radio and TV stations, and websites have participated in the April 1 tradition of making 20 reports in order to fool their audiences.
After the Second World War, a great number of American soldiers were stationed in Europe.
A police officer was stationed by the side to operate the system.
Over 95 percent of all public television stations have tele-courses.
For the five highway deaths, the author blames (A) a large heavy station wagon.

definition.zh_def: 車站；站點，通常用於公共交通系統中，供乘客上下車的地方。
definition.en_def: A place where vehicles, especially trains or buses, stop to allow passengers to board or disembark.
definition.example: We arrived at the train station just in time to catch our train.
